meanings.definition: A large receptacle or storage container for liquid or gas.
meanings.sent1: The farmer filled the tanks with water for the thirsty cows.
meanings.sent2: The gas station had huge tanks underground to store fuel.
meanings.sent3: The tanks in the kitchen were overflowing with dirty dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tank of creative ideas waiting to be unleashed.
meanings.sent5: The tanks on the roof collected rainwater for the garden.

meanings.definition: A heavily armored combat vehicle used in warfare.
meanings.sent1: The army deployed tanks to protect the soldiers in battle.
meanings.sent2: The tanks rolled through the battlefield, intimidating the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character drove a tank made of ice cream cones.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a tank, unstoppable and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The tank's metal exterior gleamed under the sun, a symbol of strength.

meanings.definition: To fail or fall behind in progress or development.
meanings.sent1: If he tanks the exam, he will have to retake it.
meanings.sent2: The project tanks if we don't meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: Her confidence tanks whenever she has to speak in public.
meanings.sent4: His mood tanks when he receives negative feedback.
meanings.sent5: The stock market tanks when there is uncertainty in the economy.
